intro: Palicourea hazenii subsp. hazenii, commonly known as the Brazilian moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its opposite, simple, and often elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds, and it is native to the tropical regions of South America. Botanically, it is notable for its medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
